Key:
(Okay, so Maria went to the next classroom over,
but... I'm worried.)

(I hope nothing bad will happen. I can't focus on
class like this.)
*Bustle*
Is that... noise coming from next door?

S...do... Shido!
Requesting, Shido. Please respond...
Hm... Yuzuru, is that you?

Wh-What's the matter, Yuzuru? What's happening
in the other class?
Request. Shido, please come over. Arusu is...

I knew it. Got it, I'll be over right away. You go
on ahead.
Roger. I'll be waiting for you.
Tohka. Sorry, but I need to ask you a favor.

...Huh? I wasn't sleeping, I was just closing
my eyes!

Calm down, Tohka. It's me. I have a favor to ask
you, so please hear me out.
Oh, Shido. What's the matter?

Seems like Maria did something next door. I'm
going to go check in on her, so can you keep a
Takadai for me while I'm gone?
Sure, go on ahead.
Thanks, Tohka.
All right, I have to head next door.
Yuzuru, tell me what's going on.

Hehe... Shido, my faithful servant. You have
finally arrived. If you wish to know what's going
on, it will be faster to see for yourself...

(Faster to see for myself? Uh, Maria is...
There she is.)

(She's in the back listening to class. Oh, not
that big of a deal.)
Excuse me, Okamine-sensei. I have a question.
*Commotion*

(Oh, seems like she has a question. But why's
everyone making so much noise?)
Yesss... What is it, Arusu-saaan...?

About what you mentioned earlier, I believe there
is a mistake.
N-Not again... That's the textbook's fault...
Ah... I see.

Affirmative. This is exactly it. Can you do
something about it?
W-We need to stop Arusu, don't we...?

(I tried to not get caught by other students, and
snuck over to where Maria was standing in the
back.)

Arusu, you can't. Don't point out the errors
in the textbook.

I had a feeling that was the case. I heard you can
point out errors in the form of a question, but
I couldn't get a good response during my testing.

I see... This isn't good. But I know I was the one
who told you to participate, so I want to figure
something out for you.

Hm... What can we do? Maybe I can ask for
someone's cooperation...
Ask Kotori to help.
Ask the Yamai Sisters to help.
Ask Miku to help.

Kotori's always dependable in times like these.
She's always supporting me from the Fraxinus.

(Although, if Kotori's been here all along, then
shouldn't she have handled it? What's my little
sister doing?)
Uh, where's Kotori?

There she is. She's focusing. I wonder what she's
doing...
Hey, Kotori. What are you doing... Hey!
Oh, Onii-chan. You can't look yet.

Now isn't the time to be putting lipstick on
Hideyoshi! You're making the people look like
they're working at Nichome!
Gosh, you're so annoying.

What? This is an emergency. Can you return to your
black ribbon form?
Finnnee.
Jeez Shido, what's your problem?
Already so mean?! And this is my fault?

Let me ask you this. Why are you leaving Arusu to
her own devices?

No, it's just... I thought she'd be fine because
you'd be here.

Arusu is observing things centered around you.
You know that, right?
Yeah...

Then you should be as close to her as you can.
Besides, if you can deal with problems as they
arise, maybe your "romance" points will go up.
Is that how it goes?

(But that doesn't mean Kotori should be doodling
on historical figures.)
Whatever. Anyways, bring Arusu over.
Okay.

"Don't "okay" me. Shido, I'm going to have to brief
you again on how to conduct yourself."
(Oh no, Kotori's entering lecture mode...)
Kotori Itsuka? What's the matter?

Don't even start with that. I need to teach you
some things, so sit down.

(At the end of the day, the great thing about
Kotori is that she's always looking out for us.)

(Maria and I had to ignore the class and listen to
what Kotori had to say. Arusu seemed interested,
so I guess it all worked out in the end.)
Oh, I have to go back now. Thanks, Kotori.
You owe me. Next time, deal with it yourself.
Okay, got it. I can't always depend on you, huh?
As long as we're clear on that.
All right... Let's go back, Maria. ...Maria?

Shido. I'm curious about something, so I'm going
to leave the classroom for a little bit.

Hey. Wait, Maria...!
She's gone...

Don't just hang your head like that. Hurry up and
go after her.
Okay, I will!

(I guess I could consult with Kaguya and Yuzuru.
The three of us should be able to figure it out.)
Kaguya, Yuzuru, any good ideas?
Thinking. How can Arusu participate in class...?

Hehe... There's that secret we learned
the other day.

Surprise. Secret... Don't tell me you're going to
use THAT, Kaguya.
Oh, what is it? Do you have a plan? What is it?

Hehe... Shido may not know. But open your eyes and
see. These are the Devil's notes!

Oh...? Hey, Kaguya... This just looks like a cute
character memo pad.
Agreed. It's very adorable.

Well, you wait and see. You write a sentence...
Done. All right Shido, you take this.
Uh, so this is... passing notes?
Yes... A fun thing to do in class.

Affirmative. We learned it the other day. It's
thrilling and something that every student should
know.
No, you're just playing around!
N-No good?
Well, I guess it is something for her to learn...

(Although its value is pretty questionable, and I
feel like we're leading her down the wrong path,
this is the idea they've come up with.)
Oh, well. Let me give it to her, then.

Oh, Shido! A reply. We need her to reply. It's
mandatory.
Agreed. Get a response for two.
Okay, fine. I'll go over.
Be careful, Snake.
No, really not a snake...
(Well anyways, I'm going to head over to Maria.)
Maria. I have something for you.
...Shido, what is this?

Uh... I guess doing secret things in class is part
of being a student.
I see. So what am I to do with this?

You read what's written inside and write a
response. Once you're done, I'll take it back to
them. Normally, you pass it around class.
Understood. Give me a few moments.
Okay...!
(Uh... What am I doing...)

(In the end, I went back and forth among the
three, delivering their notes throughout class.)
Hehe... Shido, good job.
Thank you. I appreciate it, Shido.

It was nothing. Anyways, what did you guys write?
And what was Arusu's response?

Oh, the contents written here are protected by
the maidens' promise. I cannot disclose them, even
to you.
Secret. We cannot tell.

Well, I guess... But I'm glad you guys were able
to communicate with each other. I guess I'll
take Maria back with me.
Shido, you have a moment?
Oh, perfect timing. What's the matter, Maria?

I'm curious about something. I'm going to leave
the classroom for a little while.
Hey, where are you going?!
Jeez... Anyways, Kaguya, Yuzuru. See you later.
Okay. Good luck.
Agreed. Good luck, Shido.
Leave it to me!

(Hmm, maybe I can ask Miku to help me. I'm curious
what she'd come up with, anyway.)
Miku, you got a moment? I need to ask you a favor.

Oh, darling? What is it? We're in the middle of
class～

Yeah, I heard Arusu was causing problems. I want
her to find a way to participate in class. Do you
have any ideas?

Participate in class? Gosh, darling, I thought you
came to visit me, and instead you're talking about
her?
A-Anyways... Can you lend me a hand?

Very well. Since you're the one asking, I will
help. Buuuut...
But?

I personally feel like she doesn't have to force
herself to study～
Well, but that's not right.

Well, I mean listening in class and taking notes
is such a bore.

Well, it is, but... Hey, Miku...? Out of
curiosity, how are you in class usually?
What are you talking about?

You know... How are you able to get through class
and tests?
That's easy. I ask the girls around me.

Huh...? What's the matter, darling?
You look scary.
No, I was just thinking about what you said...

Well I have my idol duties. So the teachers let me
slide～

Well that may be true, but... I think you should
participate in class too, then.
What?! I couldn't possibly!

No talking back! I'm going to bring Maria too, so
open up your notebook.
Gosh, you're such a meanie, darling...
Shido... What should I do?

I'm going to help you guys with the class. Well,
I'm not a real teacher, so I have my limitations,
but... Miku, especially you, brace yourself.
A-Ahhhh!

(In the end, I realized that Miku wasn't too
bright, so I tutored them both. Now I don't ask
why she's in my class in the virtual world.)
Wahhh, darling, you're such a meanie.

(Well, Arusu copied Miku and took notes. She
seemed interested in something new, so I guess
it worked out fine.)

I think I'll have to check in on you from time to
time, Miku.

Very well. If you're going to check my studies,
then I will work a little harder.
Okay, fine.
Oh, and also be sure to give me a kiss for trying.
That's a no.
Gosh, darling. You're always so bashful.

Shido, I'm curious about something, so I will be
leaving the classroom for a little while.
Wait, Maria! Oh, there she goes.

Shouldn't you go back soon, darling? The next
class is about to start.

Crap, you're right. And... I also need to bring
Maria back. Anyways Miku, I'll be leaving now.
Okay. Come visit me again soon, darling.
